faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-Spanish citizens enjoy identical property purchase rights as Spanish nationals. Brexit hasn't changed this – UK buyers continue purchasing freely. The process requires NIE (tax identification number), legal representation, and standard due diligence. No visa is required solely for property purchase, though residency permits depend on individual circumstances.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 10-12% beyond property price, including: transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), legal fees (1-2%), and registration costs. For this €450,000 property, expect approximately €45,000-54,000 in additional costs. Buyers can offset some expenses against mortgage arrangements and tax deductions for primary residences.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca consistently ranks among Europe's premier property markets with strong fundamentals: established international communities, reliable rental demand (€800/week typical), steady capital appreciation (8% year-on-year currently), excellent healthcare and education, and exceptional climate. Family-oriented areas like Baños y Mendigo offer particularly compelling value compared to saturated markets.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Major Spanish banks actively lend to foreign buyers with standard requirements: proof of income, employment contracts, credit history assessment, and typically 30-40% deposit requirement. Interest rates remain competitive (currently 3-4.5%). Many expat-focused mortgage brokers streamline the process specifically for international clients purchasing in Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Die jährlichen Grundsteuern (IBI) average 0.4-0.6% of property value – approximately €1,800-2,700 yearly for this €450,000 villa. Capital gains tax applies when selling (21% on profits), though primary residence exemptions often apply. Rental income is taxed at standard rates (19-45% progressive). Professional tax advice optimizes planning for individual circumstances.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Living costs run 20-30% below UK equivalents. Groceries average €250-350 monthly (family of four), dining €80-150 per week at local restaurants, utilities €80-120 monthly, and healthcare through private insurance €150-300 monthly. Total family budgets typically range €1,800-2,500 monthly including moderate entertainment and leisure – significantly less than comparable UK living.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Yes, exceptionally. Costa Blanca attracts retirees through affordable living costs, excellent healthcare with English-speaking professionals, year-round sunshine, established expat communities, and rich cultural amenities. Many retirees combine permanent residence with rental income from investment properties, creating supplementary pension income while enjoying Mediterranean lifestyle.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Flight time from UK airports to Alicante-Elche is approximately 2.5 hours. Regular direct flights operate from London, Manchester, Birmingham, and other major cities, typically costing €40-120 return. Ferry options via French ports take 24-36 hours. Proximity to UK combined with affordable flights makes regular visits manageable for families maintaining UK connections.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate delivers 320+ sunshine days annually with mild winters (12-17°C) and warm summers (28-32°C). Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring with dry summers. The climate supports outdoor year-round living – beaches, golf, and outdoor dining remain viable October through April. Perfect for families seeking active outdoor lifestyles without extreme seasonal variation.
